metadata.filename: Estimation of Distribution Algorithm Incorporating Switching.md
metadata.title: Estimation of Distribution Algorithm Incorporating Switching

tables.table_title: Table 1 Operation of processes in SEDA.
rows:
Set $t=0$, randomly generate initial population $P(0)$,
clear the switching flag.
Select a set of promising individuals $S(t)$ from $P(t)$.

Generate a set of new individuals $O(t)$ according to
distribution $p(X)$ based on $B$.
Select a set of promising individuals $Q(t)$ from $P(t)$.

Create a new population $Q^{\prime}(t)$ by applying crossover
to $Q(t)$.

Create a new population $P(t+1)$ by applying mutation
to $Q^{\prime}(t)$, set $t=t+1$.

If the switching flag is cleared and the switching cri-
terion (EDA $\rightarrow$ GA) is satisfied, set the switching flag.
If the switching flag is set and the switching criterion
(GA $\rightarrow$ EDA) is satisfied, clear the switching flag.

If the switching flag is cleared, return to step 2.
If the switching flag is set, return to step 6.
